item.description:
We always welcome people who responsibly enjoy Myles Standish State Forest to attend the monthly board meeting of the Friends of Myles Standish State Forest. Maybe this is the month you'll join us.

If you want to become involved in

  • hike/bike/trail ride leadership,
  • trail maintenance,
  • bluebird monitoring,
  • weevil wrangling
  • our annual fall fishing derby or
  • one of the many other activities sponsored by the Friends in and around the State Forest,

you don't need to attend the board meeting. Just let us know.  If you have something you want to discuss, please contact Rose before the meeting so that you can get on our agenda.

We lost of a number of founding members from the board earlier this month owing to term limits. (No one can stay on the Board for more than 6 consecutive years.)  We need new people to join us. Are you interested? Our Board bylaws require us to seek out and recruit members from eight main user groups identified when the group was started--

(Equestrians, Hikers,Bicyclists, Hunters/Fishers, Cottage Owners, Campers, Wildlife Observers,Skiers.)

We particularly need new board members who can represent the interests of :

  • Skiers  (cross country skiers and snowshoers)
  • Bicyclists  (mountain or road bicycling)

If you know anyone from the above groups who actively uses Myles Standish, please let them know about us! (The other four groups included in the board are hikers; hunters/fishers; wildlife observers and campers.)

For information on Friends' membership, visit the Friends web page (www.friendsmssf.com).
item.how_to_find_us: "The barn" is 100 yards up Lower College Pond Road from the forest headquarters.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Friends board meeting for June
